bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, June 27, 1900

div1.p: Reed is impressed with the shower installed at his quarters. He responds to family news and is pleased that his son has passed an examination to further his military career.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, June 27, 1900
div1.opener:
No. 7-
a kiss for
Pnd.
WAR DEPARTMENT,
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE,
ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM AND LIBRARY,
WASHINGTON.
Camp Columbia,
June 27th, 00
6:30 a.m.
My precious wifie:
div1.p:
I really over-
slept myself, this morning, &
hence have only a short
half hour to write to my
sweet babies- I have
just returned from the
most delicious shower-
bath imaginable; The
water sparlingly clear and
the temperature just cold
enough to make your
skin tingle & afterward
How deliciously -- You would
simply, go wild over our
Shower-bath- Well, wern't
you glad to have a letter
from dear Aunt Jane? I
must write to the charm-
ing creature right away.
of course, she will be
on to see you soon- She
must be there by the time
I come back- Isn't John-
nie Moore a “buster”, When
he strikes a stone-fence?,
I declare that I wouldn't
undertake to have to build
one of those structures
for a mint of money-
speaking of money, reminds
me that I got my check
for $71.42, for my knee-cap
yesterday, & hence won't
need to draw my July
pay while down here-
Aren't you so glad that
the dear boy did so well
on his examination? They
say that it was really
a very hard examination-
There were 6 candidates,
3 of whom passed- He calls
me up on the phone every
evening & we have a
jolly chat for about 5
minutes. He says that he
isn't studying one bit now!
Hopes to go to the U. S. in
July, but doesn't know- He
applied for the artillery,
& yesterday Gen. Lee told
me that Cap't. Harmon's en-
dorsement was a very
strong one & that he had
added another strong one
to it- I will write to Col.
Carter & ask his assis-
tance, but don't know whether
it will do any good- Weather
here simply delightful, both
day & night- Don't you and
little joy work too hard
at the flower bed & piano-
Glad you got your rug-
you will soon be very
comfortably fixed. Oh! for
a taste of those strawberries!
But I'll have a cold Mango
for breakfast- Good-bye, you
precious hearts- Write very
often- Love & kisses & kisses
and love for my sweet children,
